Docs.param: The <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress> that provides the location of the service.
The <xref:System.Uri> that contains the transport address to which the channel sends messages.
Docs.summary: Creates a object that is used to send messages to a service at a specific endpoint address through a specified transport address.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel.Contract%2A> object that represents the new channel.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The object returned is an instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext CreateSerializationContext() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a object used by channels created by the factory.
Docs.returns: A initialized with the properties of the trust client.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannelFactory.SecurityTokenResolver%2A> property is set to `null`, the ClientCertificate set on the factory Endpoint's ClientCredentials behavior will be used to create a resolver. If no such certificate is found, an empty resolver is used.
If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannelFactory.UseKeyTokenResolver%2A> is set to `null`, an empty resolver will be used.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel CreateTrustChannel (System.ServiceModel.Security.IWSTrustChannelContract innerChannel, System.ServiceModel.Security.TrustVersion trustVersion, System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext context, System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustRequestSerializer requestSerializer, System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustResponseSerializer responseSerializer);

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel CreateTrustChannel(class System.ServiceModel.Security.IWSTrustChannelContract innerChannel, class System.ServiceModel.Security.TrustVersion trustVersion, class System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext context, class System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustRequestSerializer requestSerializer, class System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustResponseSerializer responseSerializer) cil managed

Docs.param: The channel created by the base class capable of sending and receiving messages.
The version of WS-Trust that should be used.
The object that should be used to serialize WS-Trust messages.
The object that should be used to serialize WS-Trust request messages.
The object that should be used to serialize WS-Trust response messages.
Docs.summary: Creates a object using parameters that reflect the configuration of this factory.
Docs.returns: A that represents the new channel.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the that contains the set of objects used by channels created by this factory for serializing and validating tokens found in WS-Trust messages.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You cannot change the value of this property after a channel has been created.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the used to resolve security token references found in most elements of WS-Trust messages.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this property is not set, channels created by this factory will use the ClientCertificate set on the factory Endpoint's ClientCredentials behavior to create a resolver. If no such certificate is found, an empty resolver is used.
You cannot change the value of this property after a channel has been created.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the version of WS-Trust that channels created by this factory use for serializing messages.
Docs.value: The version of WS-Trust that channels created by this factory use for serializing messages.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this property is not set, channels created by this factory will use the TrustVersion set on any <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement> found on the channel factory's Endpoint object if one exists.
You cannot change the value of this property after a channel has been created.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the used to resolve security token references found in the wst:UseKey element of RST messages as well as the wst:RenewTarget element found in RST messages.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this property is not set an empty resolver is used.
You cannot change the value of this property after a channel has been created.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the used for serializing wst:RequestSecurityToken messages.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this property is not set, either a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrust13RequestSerializer> object or a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustFeb2005RequestSerializer> object will be used. The serializer that is used will correspond to the version of WS-Trust indicated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannelFactory.TrustVersion%2A> property.
You cannot change the value of this property after a channel has been created.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the used for serializing wst:RequestSecurityTokensResponse messages.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this property is not set, either a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrust13ResponseSerializer> object or a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustFeb2005ResponseSerializer> object will be used. The serializer that is used will correspond to the version of WS-Trust indicated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannelFactory.TrustVersion%2A> property.
You cannot change the value of this property after a channel has been created.
